snippet: The devaluation will set the bolívar at 6.3 instead of 4.3 to the dollar. The expected move was aimed at solidifying government finances and easing a tight market for dollars.
abstract: Venezuela announces that it is devaluing its currency, step that has long been deemed necessary but could push spiking inflation even higher.
lead_paragraph: The devaluation will set the bolívar at 6.3 instead of 4.3 to the dollar. The expected move was aimed at solidifying government finances and easing a tight market for dollars.

headline.seo: Venezuela Devalues Currency Amid Shortages and Inflation
headline.main: Venezuela Devalues Currency by a Third Amid Shortages and Inflation
headline.print_headline: Venezuela Devalues Currency by a Third Amid Shortages and Inflation
